revised_title: Evolution of Passive Continental Margins and Thermal Regime of the Northern Bay of Biscay
tldr: This article discusses the evolution of passive continental margins and the thermal regime of the northern Bay of Biscay, focusing on the results from deep drilling projects in the area. The authors found that the heat flow over the continental margin is lower than over the adjacent Western European continental area, suggesting different radioactive crustal contributions to the surface heat flow in the two areas. This information provides constraints on the debate about the nature of crustal thinning processes under the margin.
